intro: Lactucopsis chaixi, commonly known as the Tibetan lettuce, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are succulent and often used in local cuisines, while its flowers contribute to the biodiversity of alpine ecosystems. Lactucopsis chaixi plays a role in supporting pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native range.
